wikipedia_page.main: Fabia Drake OBE (born Ethel McGlinchy; 20 January 1904 – 28 February 1990) was a British actress whose professional career spanned almost 73 years during the 20th century.Drake was born in Herne Bay, Kent. Her first professional role in a film was in Fred Paul's  Masks and Faces (1917), and her last role was as Madame de Rosemonde in Miloš Forman's Valmont (1989).Drake was a lifelong friend of Noël Coward and Laurence Olivier.
